turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's ok, you'll figure it out.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: You smell weird.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Like popcorn?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I got some hair stuff.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Hair stuff?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I gotta go to work.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, I think you're probably right... because when you try to...

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Do you think it's done?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Will you please stop smoking?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: But I like to... and I don't smoke that much.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Its bad for you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Ok, I will... later.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: A Soul's Search: Finding Your True Character and calling? Is this yours?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Oh... that's nothing, someone gave it to me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't have to be embarrassed.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I'm not. It's just corny, but I'm not into it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's ok if you are.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, the record company sent these...

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Mmm, I love Cristal, let's have some.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I gotta go... and I don't really like champagne.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Are you sure you want to stay?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Are you sure you have to go?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Yeah, I know you have to work the whole time, I'll probably have more fun here. I'll call Charlie and those guys.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Ok, definitely call them, I'll be back Friday. I love you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I miss you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It'll just be a few days.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Lauren?

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Charlotte?! How's Tokyo?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: It's cool... but,I don't know... I went to a shrine today and all these little monk's were chanting... and, I didn't feel anything... I even tried ikebana, ...   and John's using hair products... I don't know who IÂ—.

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Oh, wait, can you hold on one sec?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Oh, it's nothing... I better go, I'll talk to you later.

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Ok, have fun there, you're so lucky you don't have any kids yet and you can go off to Japan... call me when you get back.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Ok, bye.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: John! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm just here shooting this band, what about you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Promoting that action movie I did...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: ...doing like twenty million interviews a day... It's soo good to see you. How long are you here for?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're here for the week. I'm shooting in Osaka for a few days.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It's amazing  there!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Have you met Charlotte? My wife.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No!  Hi! So great to meet you!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh..thanks.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Sorry if I have the worst B.O., I've been sweating in this little room with T.V. lights for hours...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh no...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: ...Well, I have the worst  headache, I have to go find some aspirin. But, call me, let's have a drink, I'm under Evelyn Waugh.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I missed you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Do you think they have a room here?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: How'd your interview go?  I'm sure you charmed the hell out of Sally.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: She's a talk show host.  They can't be charmed.  By definition.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It's great of you to let William and Susan stay at the house until he gets on his feet.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's Susan's cooking, Claire.  That's why Uncle James lets them stay.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You never said anything to me...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's probably trivial.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Shi... Sorry, honey.  I was having the weirdest dream.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Bad?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Weird.  The book again.  Sex spelled backwards...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I must really be slacking off.  Hungry?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Uh...sure...I...what?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Sushi.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I can't believe it's already starting to get dark so early.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You know, there was a guy on the radio today trying to explain why we're losing daylight.  Quarks and dark matter, things like that.  Even how daylight savings has caught up with us over the last hundred years and our universal watch is just fast, you know?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Peter, where are you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sorry.  It's just...a strange woman waltzes into my office today.  Tells me she murdered her parents and can prove Satan exists.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Did she waltz in or fly on little bat wings?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Says she can get me in to see this killer.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Now that you're on TV, you're a magnet for all the wackos out there.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Oh, Peter, you're going to pursue this.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.  Of course not.  Mmmm.  Anago.  My favorite.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Hey, what are you doing here in the middle of the day?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Forgot my car keys.  What are you doing on the fourth floor?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I spaced out.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, it's a nice surprise.  Should I hit the "stop" button?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What?  That's horrible!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, I appreciate it.  Thanks, Josef.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: When did they find her?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm still shaking.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I can't believe Will killed him.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Thank God he did.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm gonna have to get a restraining order.  What a nightmare.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I don't know.  In a way, I'm glad it all happened.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You're glad somebody tried to kill me?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No, of course not, but I think now that this has happened, a lot of things can start to come out...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, like...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Like you need to admit that losing your parents when you were twelve was traumatic.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's with me all the time, Claire, I just don't like to talk about it.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Well, it shattered your faith in everything.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm just temporarily off my game.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You need to believe in something besides yourself.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I believe in you.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: There you are!  My God, darling, I've been so worried.  Are you alright?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Claire...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: This is the person...you were talking about?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What're these?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I don't know.  What are they?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I found them in your file box.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Must be a spare set.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I thought the spare set was in the kitchen drawer.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Honey, you're exhausted.  Do you want to lie down for a little while?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I found the pentacle.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: She's been stalking you, Peter.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So you're going to kill her?  Put the gun down Claire.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Listen to me, I love you, Peter, I'm trying to protect you!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You really had me going, Claire.  I was finally ready to propose to you.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: We're still going to be together.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: What a...jerk!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Peter, are you okay?

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Nonsense, it's all of our home.  So how's work treating you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Frustrating.  Form over content. Everything's so retro.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Well, if Peter here would hop off his laurels long enough to marry you...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ...you wearing a watch, Father?

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Yes.  It's exactly...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You know, I made a reservation at Marco's for Peter's birthday dinner, but maybe you should cater it.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: What time did you make it for?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Eight.  That okay?

turns.speaker: MR. SILBERMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: And how would you describe him?

turns.speaker: MR. SILBERMAN
turns.text: Quiet.  Real quiet...

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: And on the day of the murders, his state of mind?

turns.speaker: MR. SILBERMAN
turns.text: Seemed...on edge.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: On the day of the murders  what did the defendant request?

turns.speaker: MR. SILBERMAN
turns.text: He asked to go home early.  He said he was bothered by all the people who kept telling him what to do.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: Tell the jury how many people work in that office with you and Mr. Viznick.

turns.speaker: MR. SILBERMAN
turns.text: Just me.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: George, come in.  What the hell happened to you?

turns.speaker: VIZNICK
turns.text: It's nothing.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: Sure it is.  If the guards did this, we can file charges.

turns.speaker: VIZNICK
turns.text: Not the guards.  Some of the prisoners are easily disturbed.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: You have to tell me who did it.

turns.speaker: VIZNICK
turns.text: I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
turns.text: I'm gonna go make a stink.  Sit tight. I'll make sure you get a change of clothes.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: Mr. Kelson, what a pleasure to meet you. I have to say your instincts about the criminally insane are impeccable.  I am a fan.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Quite a compliment coming from you, doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: When your secretary called, she made no mention of her coming, too.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: My secretary?

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: You're aware that this woman was party to the so-called exorcism.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, I wasn't, actually.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: You should know I never felt Mr. Birdson needed anything but professional psychiatric care.  And then, minutes after they left, he suffered a stroke. He's comatose.  No brain wave activity at all.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So you don't believe his condition is the result of anything supernatural?

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: Of course not.  They put him through severe mental stress.  Causing this aneurysm.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Your court order, Dr. Allen.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: You know I'm not comfortable with this.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: But your patient is legally entitled to it.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: This patient has been plagued with temporal lobe seizures.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: It's the patient's request, doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: I'm aware of that, but I don't think he's in any condition to make requests. I'm trying to appeal to your more...logical self, Father.  I'm concerned about harm to my patient.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Father Jeremy and Deacon John Townsend of St. Ursula's, and our associate, Maya Larkin.  Secular assistants are permitted if regarded as qualified.  Maya is eminently qualified.

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: I think I should join you.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Dr. Allen, could you please tell Mr. Kelson what you heard as you tried to enter Mr. Birdson's room?

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: I certainly hope you're not lending any credence to this.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What did you hear?

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: The patient was in great distress. Naturally he was...yelling.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: And was he in distress when you opened the door?  Or was he sitting here, relaxed, at this table?

turns.speaker: DR. ALLEN
turns.text: There is a medical explanation for everything that happened.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You heard voices, you know you did.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: I don't mean to belittle you, but we've been through this before.  Satan is not what you think he is.  Satan is not some creature.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You weren't there.  Give me time to get some proof.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: Please, Maya.  I'm trying to get us into the next century and you insist on this medieval nonsense.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: If you really believe in God, why is it so inconceivable that his enemy is just as real?

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: Maya, for the last time, I will not tolerate these obsessions.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: The doctor's concerned he may never come out of this dementia.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: He will.  He has great faith.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: But bad judgement.  And now you see how dangerous the consequences can be.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: Is he going to be okay?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: I've had it.  Townsend's dead.  The police are calling and now I see you having a scene in front of the children. I'm sorry, Maya, you've been with us for many years, but effective immediately, I'm rescinding your right to live at the church.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Father, I have nowhere else to stay.

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: You have a sister in New Orleans.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You'll do it?

turns.speaker: FATHER FRANK
turns.text: I don't have the experience.  Father Thomas should officiate.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: How're you doing?  Looking lovely as always.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Between your book sales and this TV thing, there's going to be no living with you.  And let me guess, you boiled God down to a conceit.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know how I feel.  The world is random.  The only certainty I believe in is death.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Given all that's happened, I understand. The world is random, but then there's faith.  Where are you in death without it?

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Something he said, just before...

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: He spoke to you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah.  It didn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Listen to me, Peter.  You can't let the ravings of a madman disturb you, okay?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You're right, but it's funny.  All my life I thought I was simply a man who didn't believe in any of it.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: No matter, my son, he believes in you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: But it's true.  I have no faith.  It's strange.  When that gun was pointed at my face tonight, I was surprised, but never frightened.  It was as if I knew nothing could possibly happen to me and...in that one moment I didn't care about anything.  Not eve my own life.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Peter.  Your life must matter to you because it matters to all of us who love you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know, I respect that you have such faith, James.  I don't understand it, but I want you to know that despite our differences, I admire you and I always will.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You fucking bastard.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Don't you get it?  They had their 2,000 years.  Now it's our turn.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So all that bullshit about God and faith.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: It was perfect.  The harder I pushed, the more you pulled away.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You lied to me my whole life. Everything you said, everything you did.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: Everything I did, I did for you.  I love you, Peter.  Think of it.  I'm giving you a gift, absolute power and knowledge.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You raised me, like a son.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: You are my son.  Don't you see the opportunity that lies before you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You killed my parents.

turns.speaker: FATHER JAMES
turns.text: I had to.  There was no other way. Their deaths were part of the greatest legacy I could have given you.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me?

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: I know, Maya, but you'll understand when you see this man.  I really need your strength.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: -- you wouldn't last five minutes.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Just open the door, please.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: ...the ark sank, the sun set, the ark sank again.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Father, I'm right here.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: ...the ark sank, the sun set, the ark sank again...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Father!  Thank God you're better!  I really need your help.  We've only got a few more hours.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Don't worry...about the transformation, Maya.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What do you mean "don't worry?"

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Well, in my prayers, I realized we've been fooling ourselves and probably... blown this all out of proportion.  God would never allow anything like that to happen.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So...we won?

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Yes.  We won, that's right.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: We won because Christ...triumphed over Satan?

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Um hm.  That's right, Maya.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So, if Christ won, that means, what does that mean, Father?  That Satan...

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Would you like to rest, Miette?  You must be exhausted.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So I guess Satan lost.  Satan is the weak one.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: Miette, come here and relax.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Father, please don't die.

turns.speaker: LAREAUX
turns.text: ...art sank, sun set, ark sank again...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hi, I'd like to make an appointment for Peter Kelson.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Kelson, hold on a second...

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I took one of those home pregnancy tests, but I don't want to tell him. I'm RH negative.  My blood type is negative...  If he's RH positive, I'll have to terminate.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: How many weeks are you honey/

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Thirteen.  The last time, can you believe it?  This is how he says "Goodbye?"

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: You need his blood-type.  Like right away.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Well I know he's come here before.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter...Peter Kelson.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: You just call?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I didn't know what else to do...

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Two negatives always make a positive.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh, thank you, thank you so much!

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh my God!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: ...as a narcissist, he couldn't blame himself.  He created the voices after the fact.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: May I help you?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter Kelson?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes... and you are?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I saw you on television yesterday.  You were brilliant.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Thank you.  Do you work in the building? You coming from the party?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You said that malignant narcissism was not evil.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Not pure evil.  That's correct.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: And also that...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Listen, I'm sorry, but I'm running late.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: That there is no such thing as evil with a capital "E."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Not the most popular opinion, but yes.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What if I told you I was a malignant narcissist?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A narcissist doesn't admit it.  It's the extreme of self-denial.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: And I also believe in God and the Devil. In fact, I know they exist.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, by saying that, you're acknowledging the existence of a higher power.  Which, to a narcissist, is impossible.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I murdered my parents, Mr. Kelson.  And while they deserved it, I still went to confession the following Sunday.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Ooooooh-kayyyyyy.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: In the end, the jury saw it my way.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, then it all seems to be working out for you.  Listen, Ms...?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Do you remember Henry Birdson?  The math professor who won the Salwen Medal, then went home and killed his family?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's that got to do with you?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Last week the Catholic Church certified him as genuinely possessed.  You realize how rarely they make that ruling?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: An exorcism was just held for Birdson. It failed.  Disastrously.  Which means there's still a demonic spirit present in his body.  I was wondering, perhaps you'd like to go meet Henry.  He's pretty amazing.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: On television, you seemed so sure of yourself.  If you're really that confident, you'd be willing to let someone prove you wrong?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The world would be so much simpler if it were all just about good and evil. Unfortunately I find it much more slippery and elusive place.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Well, I think it's very simple.  Here's a tape of Birdson's exorcism.  I'll be at the Public Library.  Tomorrow at 2... if you want to meet him.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: So...what did you think of the tape.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I think you gave me the wrong one.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It was blank.  Nothing on it.  You gave me the wrong one.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You're sure?  There was nothing?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I cranked it all the way up.  Nothing but hum.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So what'd I miss?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You're right.  I must've made a mistake.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Where do you get off pretending to be my secretary?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I had to.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And this is evil?  The guy had an aneurysm and now he's in a coma.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: That's their explanation.  You might not believe me...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, why should I?  Alright, what's your name, where do you live, when did you kill your parents?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We need to talk.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter, please...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Last night a guy named John Townsend tried to shoot me and now I find out you knew him.  What the fuck is going on?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Please, the children.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why did he try to kill me?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Townsend believed, just as God became man in Christ.  So Satan will assume human form.  I believe it too.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And the point is?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: At the exorcism, Birdson boasted that Satan is about to take over the body of a man.  You are that man, Peter.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?!?!

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: It's true.  Birdson knew your name, he was writing it in numerical code.  It wasn't easy but I figured it out.  It spelled your name.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why didn't Birdson just say so?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: If you're possessed, you can't reveal anything Satan wants hidden.  Unless you trick him.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Trick him.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: The good outwitting the bad.  It's like Birdson had a split personality.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You should think about getting professional help.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You're already contaminated.  It's why you couldn't hear the tape.  There's probably a pentacle near your bed.  To sanctify you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm not going to be drawn into this.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I know this sounds crazy.  I understand. Check your parents' blood types.  Are you sure your parents are your birth parents?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: My parents are dead.  Don't even think of bringing them into this.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You're about to become the anti-Christ who is born unholy and becomes the door to eternal suffering in this world.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: If you or any of your lunatic friends ever come near me again...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't understand what's going on.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: There's no reason why you should.  This has been planned from your birth. You fit all the criteria that we know of.  Never baptized, born of incest, devoid of faith...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: But I was baptized.  And I certainly wasn't born of incest.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You were not baptized.  At least I don't believe it was Christian.  Your baptism was performed by your uncle, James McKenzie.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: The only baptism he ever performed in seven years as pastor at Bedford.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Seven years.  One baptism?  He's your mother's only brother

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Do you know your parents' blood types?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I looked at the coroner's report.  My father's O positive and my mother...A negative.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter, your blood-type is AB negative. There's no way your birth father can be O positive.  You father is not who you think he is.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So...then the coroner's report is probably wrong.  I mean...this is ridiculous.  There's been a mistake.  I don't believe any of this.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Then why are you here?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter, I believe your baptism was perverted.  Look at your certificate. Your mother was the only witness to it. Your blood-type doesn't match who you thought your father was.  Peter...I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And if what you're saying is true, what would happen to me?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: I don't know.  I do know that people who are possessed have to accept evil in some way.  I don't know if it works the same way in this instance.  I don't even know when it's going to happen.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: When Townsend tried to kill me, he said something strange like...  "The time of transformation is near..."

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Townsend, he had some of Father's books.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What are you looking for exactly?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: The books themselves or maybe some pages he ripped out.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: We needed to know all we could.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm going to look around.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Nothing yet.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'll go outside and take a look in the garage.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Get up!!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's the...OH SHIT!

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Peter, let go of the chair!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: When's your birthday?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hang on, get it up, go on, higher.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Your 33rd birthday.  The transformation will be a perversion of Christ's rising from the dead.  Townsend discovered it in one of Lareaux's books.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: It'll happen at the exact time of your birth.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That can't be right.  My birthday's tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: He couldn't stop us and that's how he was punished.  Peter, what time were you born?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't know.  Probably have a copy of my birth certificate...my apartment.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: There's nothing else here.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's the bible for?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Comfort.
